newsitem.title: UK: LME copper prices steady during evening session.
newsitem.headline: LME copper prices steady during evening session.

text.p: Copper price on the London Metal Exchange (LME) steadied during Tuesday's evening session after a volatile day before Wednesday's options expiry, traders said.

The LME's December options declaration was one of the major factors behind recent volatility as various strike prices, from $2,300 to $2,600 swung into and out of play, prompting bouts of covering and liquidation.
At 1900 GMT three months copper was quoted at $2,180/$2,185 per tonne, barely changed from the kerb close.
Aluminium was a little firmer adding to a short-covering gain seen on the late kerb. It was quoted at $1,530/$1,532, up about $5.00 from the late kerb close.
The rest of the metals were little changed from kerb levels.
